conclusion: Determine if displacements of cars A and B are the same by analyzing the area under the velocity-time graph.
Displacement is given by the area under the velocity-time graph.
The area under the velocity-time graph for Car A from t=0 to t=t1 is shown as a shaded region.
The area under the velocity-time graph for Car B from t=0 to t=t1 is also shown as a shaded region.
The area under Car A's graph is larger than the area under Car B's graph.
Since the area under Car A's graph is larger, the displacement of Car A is greater than Car B during the time interval.
The displacements of cars A and B are not the same; Car A has a greater displacement.
